content.raw: This pull request seems to diverge from the rest of the code in the repo. It doesn't use routes, models and controllers, for example. Shouldn't we try to stick to a pattern? It makes it easier to debug and quicker to bring new people onboard.
content.html: This pull request seems to diverge from the rest of the code in the repo. It doesn't use routes, models and controllers, for example. Shouldn't we try to stick to a pattern? It makes it easier to debug and quicker to bring new people onboard.

content.raw: The portal is at fault here. Auth and sim are the pattern, the portal was made with the mean stack, and we are not using it for this project
content.html: The portal is at fault here. Auth and sim are the pattern, the portal was made with the mean stack, and we are not using it for this project

content.raw: I know I'm annoying with documentation, but if there's a pattern, I feel like it should be documented. Especially if it diverges from all the rest of the code in the repo. Otherwise we're all working based on our unique ways of perceiving the project.

There's a test failure since I merged from default, this fixes it:

diff -r 0b8e9b900669 test/mocha/simulator/controller.js
--- a/test/mocha/simulator/controller.js    Tue Sep 20 13:59:24 2016 -0700
+++ b/test/mocha/simulator/controller.js    Tue Sep 20 14:53:50 2016 -0700
@@ -122,10 +122,14 @@
           data.result[0].permissions[0].username.should.be.equal(adminUser);
           data.result[0].permissions[0].permissions.readOnly.should.be.equal(false);

-          data.result[1].name.should.be.equal("sgroup");
+          data.result[1].name.should.be.equal("machinetypes");
           data.result[1].permissions[0].username.should.be.equal(adminUser);
           data.result[1].permissions[0].permissions.readOnly.should.be.equal(false);

+          data.result[2].name.should.be.equal("sgroup");
+          data.result[2].permissions[0].username.should.be.equal(adminUser);
+          data.result[2].permissions[0].permissions.readOnly.should.be.equal(false);
+
           done();
         });
       });
